comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content:
I knew a farmer once who would stay on "old time", in his case he ignored the one hour movements in March and October.

British Summer Time was first established by the Summer Time Act 1916, after a campaign by builder William Willett. His original proposal was to move the clocks forward by 80 minutes, in 20-minute weekly steps on Sundays in April and by the reverse procedure in September. In 1916 BST began on 21 May and ended on 1 October.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] So do you reckon the bus service ignored the change in the hour then (presumably alongside other people like your farmer, or maybe to suit people like your farmer)?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment._content: www.census.nationalarchives.ie/reels/nai001289082/ Probably the same Hickey living with his Mother and Sister in 1901 and listed as a Merchant. He was 36 in 1901 and 47 in 1911!

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] She's claiming to have taken them with a flatbed scanner. Possibly she got hold of original prints rather than having infiltrated library towers.

comment.author: 38401430@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] The age change will have been "made" to make his mother eligible for pension? There are a lot of these disparities between the 1901 and 1911 Irish census for this reason.

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] perhaps his birthday was on 1st April in which case the ages would correlate!

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/8468254@N02] That's ok. Never thought for a moment we'd been "infiltrated".  :)

I just always like if people mention the NLI to spread the love for our photos...

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/77199267@N03] Absolutely, although I like [http://www.flickr.com/photos/38401430@N06]'s pension suggestion too! 

The 1901 census was on 31 March, while the 1911 census was on 2 April...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
The New Old Time Limerick In Old Times a woman called Anna Thought Hickey's was heaven-sent manna. She was told by a sparrow New Time flies like an arrow ... Fruit flies like an Old Time banana.
[with apologies to Groucho]
